meanings.definition: The holding of political views that favor traditional values and social stability.
meanings.sent1: Many people in our town believe in conservatisms and support traditional ways of life.
meanings.sent2: His conservatisms led him to vote for the candidate who promised to uphold traditional values.
meanings.sent3: The conservatisms of the old mayor were so strong that he refused to allow any changes to the town's annual festival.
meanings.sent4: Her conservatisms were like a shield against the winds of change, protecting the community's traditions.
meanings.sent5: The conservatisms of the group were so deeply rooted that they resisted any new ideas or innovations.

meanings.definition: The practice of preserving or protecting something, such as cultural heritage or natural resources.
meanings.sent1: Conservatisms in architecture aim to maintain the historical beauty of buildings for future generations.
meanings.sent2: The conservatisms of the environmental group led to the protection of the endangered species in the area.
meanings.sent3: His conservatisms in collecting antique coins bordered on obsession, as he refused to sell or trade any of them.
meanings.sent4: The conservatisms of the park ranger were like a fortress guarding the natural wonders of the forest.
meanings.sent5: Through his conservatisms in farming practices, he ensured the land remained fertile for years to come.
